name: Grand Hotel Mediterraneo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We flew with Ryanair from Glasgow to Pisa. Transfer time from Pisa to Florence is just over an hour by train.
reviews.title: Hotel is lovely...location not so central

likes.disliked: — Location not so central and no bus stop close by

reviews.text: Hotel itself is very nice we booked on lastminute.com and got a good deal with american breakfast and romantic mal for two.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with Beautiful People

likes.disliked: — No Swimming Pool and no Gym for exercise

reviews.text: We are not lazy by any means but felt that the distance between the hotel and Florence was not particularly close. Especially when you arrive and have no idea where you are going. Taxi fare from Florence central is just over 10 euro. Im sure if you are there for more than a couple of days then you will find your way about. I would imagine it would take over 20 minutes to walk into town.
reviews.title: Fantastic friendly Hotel

likes.liked: — lovely airy room facing the river Arno
likes.disliked: — Only a Shower a Bath is always nice after a busy day !

reviews.text: As mentioned close to the River Arno. Overall i could not complain about the hotel and the staff were all friendly and the rooms were clean and tidy.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and Safe, staffs are very helpful, food is very good. The Grand Hotel Mediterraneo has a wonderful view over the famous river Arno banks (called "Lungarni"), near the beautiful Piazza Santa Croce, with a stunning panorama of the city Renaissance beauties along the river Arno and on the Florentine hills. Whether you are staying in Florence for work or for a sightseeing tour, you will find the warmth of the typical Florentine hospitality, in a modern and comfortable setting. The hotel position is ideal for its closeness to the city historical centre. The Grand Hotel Mediterraneo is very close to the most important monuments, including Piazza Santa Croce, Piazzale Michelangelo, the Uffizi Gallery and Ponte Vecchio. At walking distance from the hotel you can find the most glamorous shopping area, such as Via Tornabuoni, Via Roma, Via Calzaiuoli and Via della Vigna Nuova. (Regin Lagaac -Cambridge UK)
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights during a tour of Italy. This was the worst of the three hotels that we stayed in. Room was small and overlooked a back parking lot. The bathroom was even smaller with a shower so small that you could not even turn around in it. It was almost impossible to sit on the toilet which was wedged between the wall and the shower without hitting your arm on the toilet paper hanger. It certainly did not look like the pictures that were posted. It was also exceedingly noisy as many tour groups are booked here, especially teens. Carpets and room decor need some renovation. Food was ok but nothing to write home about. Location was a good walk from everything. The worst part however was the indifference of the front desk. Good luck if you have a real problem. The place has no charm or character (very production line) We were glad to leave and would definitely not stay here again.
reviews.title: Not very impressed

reviews.text: This is a decent hotel just outside the historic center.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.text: It is quite large and was used by many tour groups when we were there. It felt that we were the only ones not part of some group - actually, it felt that staff didn't know there were any guests in the hotel not part of a group.
reviews.title: AAA+

likes.liked: — Lobby made you feel like you were staying at the best place in the world
likes.disliked: — Rooms can be hard to find.

reviews.text: Breakfast was reasonable.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is very limited, although there is metered parking right outside (free at night).
reviews.title: What a shame

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights during our recent visit to Florence. While the hotel facilities are really more 3 star, I gave it 4 because of the great deal we got through their website. During a heavy tourist weekend in Florence (first week of September) when hotels were pretty solidly booked or were going for well over 200 euros a night, we were able to get a 95 euro per night rate including breakfast. For that price, this review gets 4 stars.
reviews.title: Good hotel for price, close enough to center

likes.liked: — Very good deal on their website, away from tourist frenzy but still close enough to the center
likes.disliked: — No irons anywhere in the hotel

reviews.text: Like others have mentioned, this is (American) tour group central. There were at least 5 groups while we were there, but we only really ran into them at breakfast, and like another poster mentioned, the hotel treats everyone pretty much the same, tour group or not.
reviews.title: Large, Busy but very efficient. Great Breakfast!

reviews.text: While I fell in love with Florence, I found Florentines to be a bit curt. However, the front desk clerks were always helpful and friendly. The lobby and room decor is "classic 80s", I guesss I'd call it. You can tell it's probably from that era, but it's an 80s look that doesn't really go tacky (i.e., completely safe). We were fine with paying 5 euros to use the computers in the lobby for 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Good hotel but a little out of the way

likes.liked: — It was quite and the room had a balcony - get a room with one of those!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is only average, but if you pick the right items, you can fill up at least 'til a late lunch. Generally, stick to the breads, cereals, pastries and cold meats, and avoid the eggs and bacon, neither of which looked like the real thing.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, 121, was standard and on the small side. It was, however, very clean and even had a flat-screeen tv with about 20 channels (mostly Italian). Our bathroom was big, with two wash basins, a toilet that was a little too high and a space-age type shower. We didn't have problems with noise from neighboring rooms but we were out all day and didn't get back until late at night, when we showered and went right to sleep.
reviews.title: Decent hotel...unfortunate location

likes.disliked: — Location, noise level both inside and out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We passed the hotel in our search for a night in Firenze, the reception was very professional, the room OK, but at the buffet breakfast we were very happy to find hot omlettes, after some hotels which offered only cold things, but the omlette was cold and had a very funny taste. We told the waiters that the heating is not working and that the omlette was cold, they were very kind and brought us another one, but still, it was lukewarm and not eateable. It's a pity, because in other aspects the staff & hotel were very agreable.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel, hated the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a comfortable and pleasant stay at this hotel which is about a 10-15 minute walk from the city centre. It is located next to the River Arno and there is a riverside cafe opposite where you can sit out for a cool drink in the evening. The bedroom was clean and comfortable as was the bathroom which appeared to be newly refurbished.
reviews.title: Nice clean and comfortable hotel

likes.disliked: — Air con is only available in the evening (during April).

reviews.title: Great location not so great hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast time is busy. It's a help yourself buffet style with lots of choice (hot and cold). The hotel seems popular for coach parties and if you are not part of a group tour you need to make this clear at breakfast as there are two dining areas for tours and others. The breakfast room for people who are not part of a tour is available until 10 am whilst the one for tour groups closes at 9.

reviews.title: Small Bathroom but very clean
reviews.text: The hotel has internet facilities (5 Euros for half an hour if you don't have your laptop with you).
You can book the open top bus city tour from the hotel reception which takes you round the major sights and you can hop on and off as you like.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

description: The Grand Hotel Mediterraneo is situated in a strategic position, just 5 minutes walking to Piazza Santa Croce, 10 minutes to Michelangelo Square, 10 minutes to Uffizi Gallery or to the famous Ponte Vecchio but in the same time outside of the limited traffic zone of Florence;Easy to reach by car from the motorway A1 exit Firenze Sud.The hotel overlooks the Arno River, where it's possible to run or cycling.Services available:331 rooms, with Suite, Junior suite , Panorami Deluxe, superior and classic rooms; Restaurants; Bar terrace; Congress Center; Large and confortable Hall; Wi-fi in all the hotel, private garage.
